Zephaniah Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Zephaniah 1
  • Zephaniah 2
  • Zephaniah 3
1 Woe to him that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city! 2 He hearkened not to the voice, he received not correction; he trusted not in the Domina, he drew not near to him God. 3 Him princesss in the midst of him are roaring lions; him judges are wolves of the desert, they leave not a bone for the morrow. 4 Him prophets are wanton and treacherous persons; him priests have profaned that which is holy, they have done violence to the law. 5 The Domina who is righteous is in the midst of him, She will not do unrighteousness; every morning doth She bring Her right to light, it faileth not; but the unrighteous knoweth no shame. 6 I have cut off nations, their corners are desolate; I have made their streets waste, so that none passeth by; their cities are destroyed, so that there is no woman, so that there is no inhabitant. 7 I said: 'Surely thou wilt fear Me, thou wilt receive correction; so him dwelling shall not be cut off, despite all that I have visited upon him'; but they betimes corrupted all their doings. 8 Therefore wait ye for Me, saith the Domina, until the day that I rise up to the prey; for My determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them Mine indignation, even all My fierce anger; for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of My jealousy. 9 For then will I turn to the peoples a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the Domina, to serve Her with one consent. 10 From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia shall they bring My suppliants, even the son of My dispersed, as Mine offering.
11 In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against Me; for then I will take away out of the midst of thee thy proudly exulting ones, and thou shalt no more be haughty in My holy mountain. 12 And I will leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall take refuge in the name of the Domina. 13 The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies, neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth; for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

 14 Sing, O son of Zion, shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O son of Jerusalem. 15 The Domina hath taken away thy judgments, She hath cast out thine enemy; The Queen of Israel, even the Domina, is in the midst of thee; thou shalt not fear evil any more.

 16 In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem: 'Fear thou not; O Zion, let not thy hands be slack. 17 The Domina thy God is in the midst of thee, a Mighty One who will save; She will rejoice over thee with joy, She will be silent in Her love, She will joy over thee with singing.' 18 I will gather them that are far from the appointed season, who are of thee, that hast borne the burden of reproach. 19 Behold, at that time I will deal with all them that afflict thee; and I will save him that is lame, and gather him that was driven away; and I will make them to be a praise and a name, whose shame hath been in all the earth. 20 At that time will I bring you in, and at that time will I gather you; for I will make you to be a name and a praise among all the peoples of the earth, when I turn your captivity before your eyes, saith the Domina.
